title.narrative: Backstage to the Future - A CSO-led Combat against Human Trafficking and Unsafe Migration in Vietnam

description.narrative: Backstage to the Future is a three year project with funding from the European Union and the UK Government. The project will support a network of Youth Unions in five provinces in Viet Nam to develop their capacity and employ creative approaches in mobilising and sensitising all levels of society (public, private, civil) to respond to the problem of human trafficking and unsafe migration.

Result 1: Comprehensive data to understand and address human trafficking issues for the planning, monitoring and reporting on anti-trafficking efforts, including the implementation of policies and legal framework. Result 2: Improved capacity for CSOs in using critical human trafficking information and innovative approaches to plan and devise actions combating human trafficking and unsafe migration. Result 3: Increased private sector support, including financial, in-kind, collaboration and development opportunities for CSOs/CBOs’ anti-trafficking efforts and job/training/alternative livelihoods pathways for VoTs/PVoTs. Result 4: Improved awareness leading to social and behavioural change at all levels of society, including relevant public bodies, private sector actors, and vulnerable communities in response to the problem of human trafficking and unsafe migration.

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to enhancing the role of Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) in Vietnam’s efforts to combat human trafficking. The specific objective of the project is to enable grassroots CSOs to employ innovative approaches to mobilise and sensitise all levels of society (public, private, civil) to respond to the problem of human trafficking and unsafe migration in 10-15 hot-spot source communities (HSCs) in Viet Nam.

The three target groups come from all levels of society: civil, private and public, and are particularly those seen as duty bearers in protecting the rights of victims and potential victims of trafficking. Target Group 1 are 10-15 grassroots CSOs and other community-based organisations (CBOs), totalling 200-300 people. Target Group 2 are private sector actors from national corporates to local businesses and enterprises who will be engaged in initiatives combatting human trafficking and unsafe migration. Target Group 3 are government officials from Ministry of Public Security and Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs and line departments, and local authorities, who play essential roles in providing assistance, protection and support to victims of trafficking (VoTs) and potential victims of trafficking (PVoTs).
